intro: Dendrolobium olivaceum, commonly known as the yellow burr wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and woody pods. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions such as Queensland and New South Wales. Its leaves are bipinnate, and it produces distinctive, spiny seed pods that contain edible seeds. Dendrolobium olivaceum is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
